cards.title: Slenderman
cards.description: A tall, thin, horrifying figure with unnaturally long arms and a featureless face, is reputed to be responsible for the haunting and disappearance of countless children and teens.

cards.title: The Rake
cards.description: A humanoid creature with pale skin, long arms, and a mouth full of sharp teeth. It is known to stalk and attack humans, often causing them to go insane.

cards.title: The Mothman
cards.description: A creature with glowing red eyes and large wings, is said to be a harbinger of doom and disaster.

cards.title: The Jersey Devil
cards.description: A creature with the body of a kangaroo, the head of a horse, bat-like wings, and a forked tail, is said to haunt the Pine Barrens of New Jersey. It is often associated with livestock killings and other unexplained events.

cards.title: The Wendigo
cards.description: A creature with the body of a human and the head of a deer, is said to be a cannibalistic spirit that haunts the forests of the northern United States and Canada. It is often associated with the winter and the hunger that comes with it.

cards.title: The Chupacabra
cards.description: A creature with the body of a dog, the head of a reptile, and sharp spines running down its back, is said to attack and drain the blood of livestock.

cards.title: The Flatwoods Monster
cards.description: A creature with a spade-shaped head, glowing eyes, and a metallic body, is said to have been sighted in the town of Flatwoods, West Virginia.

cards.title: The Dover Demon
cards.description: A creature with a large, hairless head, glowing eyes, and long, thin arms and legs, is said to have been sighted in the town of Dover, Massachusetts.

cards.title: The Hopkinsville Goblins
cards.description: A group of small, green, goblin-like creatures, is said to have been sighted in the town of Hopkinsville, Kentucky. They are often associated with sightings of UFOs and other unexplained phenomena.

cards.title: The Loveland Frog
cards.description: A creature with the body of a frog and the head of a lizard, is said to have been sighted in the town of Loveland, Ohio.

cards.title: The Fresno Nightcrawler
cards.description: A creature with a long, thin body and no visible arms, is said to have been sighted in the town of Fresno, California.

cards.title: Weeping Angel
cards.description: A quantum-locked alien race from the British television series Doctor Who. They appear as statues when observed, but can move at incredible speeds when unobserved.

cards.title: The Loch Ness Monster
cards.description: A creature said to inhabit Loch Ness, a large freshwater lake in Scotland. It is often described as a large, long-necked, and humpbacked creature.

cards.title: Kappa
cards.description: A creature from Japanese folklore, often depicted as a humanoid with a turtle-like shell and a dish on its head. Kappas are known for their mischievous behavior and their love for cucumbers.

cards.title: Unknown
cards.description: A mysterious creature from the Willy Chocolate Show. Not much is known about it.

cards.title: Ningen
cards.description: A creature from Japanese folklore, often described as a giant humanoid with pale skin and a featureless face. Ningen are said to inhabit the icy waters of the Antarctic.

cards.title: The Mongolian Death Worm
cards.description: A creature said to inhabit the Gobi Desert in Mongolia. It is often described as a large, red, worm-like creature with the ability to spit venom.

cards.title: The Bunyip
cards.description: A creature from Australian Aboriginal mythology, often described as a large, water-dwelling creature with a long neck, sharp teeth, and a loud, booming call.

cards.title: The Yowie
cards.description: A creature from Australian Aboriginal mythology, often described as a large, hairy, ape-like creature that inhabits the forests and mountains of Australia.

cards.title: The Drop Bear
cards.description: A creature from Australian folklore, often described as a large, carnivorous koala that drops from trees to attack unsuspecting victims.

cards.title: George Washingtonâ€™s Dodge Challenger
cards.description: The Dodge Challenger associated with George Washington is a legendary vehicle that has become part of American folklore. It is often described as a powerful, freedom-loving muscle car that roared through the streets during the American Revolutionary War.

cards.title: Godzilla
cards.description: A giant, prehistoric sea monster that is often depicted as a destructive force of nature. Godzilla has appeared in numerous films and is a popular icon of Japanese pop culture.

cards.title: Destroyer's Special Shotgun
cards.description: A powerful shotgun wielded by the legendary demon hunter, Destroyer. It is said to be capable of destroying even the most powerful demons with a single shot. This shotgun is unobtainable, part of an easter giveaway.
